{{cpp/title|streamsize}}
{{cpp/io/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=ios|
typedef /*implementation-defined*/ streamsize;
}}

The type {{tt|std::streamsize}} is a signed integral type used to represent the number of characters transferred in an I/O operation or the size of an I/O buffer. It is used as a signed counterpart of {{lc|std::size_t}}, similar to the POSIX type {{tt|ssize_t}}.

===Notes===
Except in the constructors of {{lc|std::strstreambuf}}, negative values of {{tt|std::streamsize}} are never used.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;type_traits&gt;

static_assert(std::is_signed_v&lt;std::streamsize&gt;);

int main()
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; sizeof(std::streamsize) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|p=true
|output=
8
}}
